title: Limit email address length

profile.name: Gratipay
profile.about: Gratitude? Gratipay! The easiest way for your company to pay for open source.

vulnerability_information:
I can able to add a email address to 255 character or more,as per RFC the maximum length allowed for an email address is 255 characters.

For more info : 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/386294/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-valid-email-address/574698#574698

related report:
https://hackerone.com/reports/28632
vulnerability_information_html:
I can able to add a email address to 255 character or more,as per RFC the maximum length allowed for an email address is 255 characters.

For more info :
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/386294/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-valid-email-address/574698#574698

related report:
https://hackerone.com/reports/28632

activities.message: How is this a security issue?
activities.markdown_message: How is this a security issue?

activities.message:
A large amount of data can cause significant resource consumption on behalf of the server and would be an easy target for Denial Of Service attack.

Normally all sites have a email maximum length is 255 character to prevent Denial Of Service attack.
activities.markdown_message:
A large amount of data can cause significant resource consumption on behalf of the server and would be an easy target for Denial Of Service attack.

Normally all sites have a email maximum length is 255 character to prevent Denial Of Service attack.

activities.message: Accepting as a theoretical risk, which carries a $1 bounty per [our security program](https://hackerone.com/gratipay).
activities.markdown_message: Accepting as a theoretical risk, which carries a $1 bounty per our security program.

activities.message:
Sorry @gokuu @jaypatel, I'm not able to reproduce your result.

### Steps

1. Put a large email address in the paste buffer (e.g., on Mac OS: `python -c 'print("{}@example.com".format("a"*10000))'|pbcopy`).
1. Browse to `https://gratipay.com/~$username/emails/`
1. Paste email address and click "Add email address".
1. Reload page.
1. Click "Remove" next to large email address.

### Expected

Address is promptly removed.

### Actual

Address is promptly removed.
activities.markdown_message:
Sorry @gokuu @jaypatel, I'm not able to reproduce your result.

Steps

  1. Put a large email address in the paste buffer (e.g., on Mac OS: python -c 'print("{}@example.com".format("a"*10000))'|pbcopy).
  2. Browse to https://gratipay.com/~$username/emails/
  3. Paste email address and click "Add email address".
  4. Reload page.
  5. Click "Remove" next to large email address.

Expected

Address is promptly removed.

Actual

Address is promptly removed.

activities.message:
Hello Chad Whitacre,

Attacker scenario  :- 

he sender could try to give you such a long email that it results in a denial of service for other people. For example, if the email is 1GB of data and you spend all your time accept it until you run out of memory. Now suppose this person sends you this email as many times as you are willing to accept. If you're not careful about the other parameters involved this could lead to a DoS attack.
activities.markdown_message:
Hello Chad Whitacre,

Attacker scenario :-

he sender could try to give you such a long email that it results in a denial of service for other people. For example, if the email is 1GB of data and you spend all your time accept it until you run out of memory. Now suppose this person sends you this email as many times as you are willing to accept. If you're not careful about the other parameters involved this could lead to a DoS attack.

activities.message: @jaypatel Thanks. Can you please paste the email address you used in the video? It is different from the one in my repro steps, and I suspect you're hitting a non-security-related bug in email removal. If you could whittle down that email address to a minimal failing test case that would be appreciated.
activities.markdown_message: @jaypatel Thanks. Can you please paste the email address you used in the video? It is different from the one in my repro steps, and I suspect you're hitting a non-security-related bug in email removal. If you could whittle down that email address to a minimal failing test case that would be appreciated.

activities.message: Sorry for the response delay, I forgot to reply to this notification! I did not worked on this issue and can't find any commit related to one size restriction. Currently, the `email` field is really permissive (aka. totally not following the email RFC), and it's creating unwelcome behaviours like #135590. It's added on my list and I'll dig into this soon.
activities.markdown_message: Sorry for the response delay, I forgot to reply to this notification! I did not worked on this issue and can't find any commit related to one size restriction. Currently, the email field is really permissive (aka. totally not following the email RFC), and it's creating unwelcome behaviours like #135590. It's added on my list and I'll dig into this soon.
